com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.utils

Class BlockUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.utils.MaterialUtil
      • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.utils.BlockUtil

  • public class BlockUtil
extends MaterialUtil
    Multiple Block utilities you can use to manipulate blocks and get block information

      • getData

        public static org.bukkit.material.MaterialData getData(org.bukkit.block.Block block)
        Directly obtains the Material Data from the block
        This alternative does not create a Block State and is preferred if you only need material data

      • getData

                            java.lang.Class<T> type)

        Parameters:
        block - to get the Material data for
        type - to cast to
        Returns:
        The cast material data, or null if there was no data or if casting failed

      • getManhattanDistance

        public static int getManhattanDistance(org.bukkit.Location b1,
                                       org.bukkit.Location b2,
                                       boolean checkY)
        Calculates the so-called 'Manhatten Distance' between two locations
        This is the distance between two points without going diagonally
        Parameters:
        b1 - location
        b2 - location
        checkY - state, True to include the y distance, False to exclude it
        Returns:
        The manhattan distance

      • getManhattanDistance

        public static int getManhattanDistance(org.bukkit.block.Block b1,
                                       org.bukkit.block.Block b2,
                                       boolean checkY)
        Calculates the so-called 'Manhatten Distance' between two blocks
        This is the distance between two points without going diagonally
        Parameters:
        b1 - block
        b2 - block
        checkY - state, True to include the y distance, False to exclude it
        Returns:
        The Manhattan distance

      • applyPhysics

        @Deprecated
public static void applyPhysics(org.bukkit.block.Block block,
                                             int callertypeid)
        Deprecated. 
        Performs Physics at the block specified
        Parameters:
        block - to apply physics to
        callertypeid - of the Material, the source of these physics (use 0 if there is no caller)

      • applyPhysics

        public static void applyPhysics(org.bukkit.block.Block block,
                                org.bukkit.Material callerType)
        Performs Physics at the block specified. The block itself is also updated.
        Parameters:
        block - to apply physics to
        callerType - Material, the source of these physics (use Air if there is no caller)

      • applyPhysics

        public static void applyPhysics(org.bukkit.block.Block block,
                                org.bukkit.Material callerType,
                                boolean updateSelf)
        Performs Physics at the block specified
        Parameters:
        block - to apply physics to
        callerType - Material, the source of these physics (use Air if there is no caller)
        updateSelf - whether the block itself is updated. With false, only surrounding blocks are notified.

      • getUpdatePacket

        public static CommonPacket getUpdatePacket(org.bukkit.block.BlockState state)
        Obtains a new packet that can be used to update tile entity (block state) information to nearby players
        Returns null if none are needed or supported by the tile entity
        Parameters:
        blockState - to get the update packet for
        Returns:
        update packet

        Sets the alignment of Rails Note that this only supports the rails that can curve.
        Parameters:
        rails - to set the alignment for
        from - direction
        to - direction
